description:
Just like other browsers, Firefox has a rich set of add-ons or extensions, which provide added functionality to make browsing the web much more fun, faster, and safer. The add-ons can be classified into various categories such as language & support, search tools, appearance, alerts & updates, and so on.

The post 32 Most Used Firefox Add-Ons to Improve Productivity in Linux appeared first on Linux Today.
title: 32 Most Used Firefox Add-Ons to Improve Productivity in Linux

description:
This detailed tutorial provides a concise introduction to the Rust programming language, followed by clear instructions on how to install Rust using rustup on Linux. It also guides you through updating Rust, creating and running a sample Rust program, and finally, how to uninstall Rust from your Linux system.

The post Beginner’s Tutorial: Setting Up Rust Using Rustup on Linux Systems appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Beginner’s Tutorial: Setting Up Rust Using Rustup on Linux Systems
